meanings.definition: To bring to a state of perfection; fulfill
meanings.sent1: She consummates her painting by adding the final brush strokes.
meanings.sent2: The chef consummates the dish by adding a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: The magician consummates his trick with a grand finale that leaves the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The sunset consummates the day, painting the sky in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner consummates his race by crossing the finish line with a triumphant smile.

meanings.definition: To complete (a marriage) with the first act of sexual intercourse
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, couples consummate their marriage on their wedding night.
meanings.sent2: The newlyweds consummate their love in a private and intimate moment.
meanings.sent3: The romantic comedy movie humorously portrays the awkwardness of trying to consummate a marriage.
meanings.sent4: The union of two souls consummates in a physical expression of love.
meanings.sent5: The wedding vows are just the beginning; the true bond is consummated in the act of love.

meanings.definition: To bring to a state of completion
meanings.sent1: The final piece of the puzzle consummates the picture.
meanings.sent2: The last chapter consummates the novel, tying up all loose ends.
meanings.sent3: The construction project is consummated with the installation of the last beam.
meanings.sent4: The handshake consummates the business deal, sealing the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The last note of the symphony consummates the musical journey, leaving the audience in awe.
